subject: Economics
title: Inequality and Democracy: Can They Coexist?
description: A 60-second lesson on Inequality and Democracy: Can They Coexist?.

hook.text: In a true democracy, the majority could vote to redistribute wealth from the rich minority. So why doesn't it happen?

buildup.text: Extreme inequality gives the wealthy disproportionate political power through lobbying, media ownership.

discovery.text: Gilens and Page found that US policy reflects the preferences of the wealthy almost perfectly and average citizens'.

twist.text: Populist movements emerge when people feel democracy has been captured.

climax.text: Extreme inequality and democracy are in tension.

punchline.text: Democracy promises equal voice. Inequality delivers unequal volume.

quiz.question: What did Gilens and Page find about US policymaking?
options: Policy outcomes closely match wealthy Americans' preferences but show almost no correlation with average citizens' wishes
